main_definition: Rows refer to a line or series of things aligned closely together, either in general usage (objects) or as an idiomatic expression indicating disagreement or argument among people.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A sequence of objects arranged side by side
meanings_and_examples.example: The books were neatly stacked in rows on the shelf.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An arrangement or order of people who are engaged in an argument or dispute
meanings_and_examples.example: During the meeting, there were several rows as different departments argued over budget allocations.
